Steam (ST): The Book of the Single Truth was sealed in crystal by Battler.
Umineko Project (UP): The Book of the Single Truth, sealed in crystal by Battler.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人によって、水晶に封印された一なる真実の書。
Russian (RU): Книга единственной правды, запечатанная Баттлером в кристалле.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Livro da Única Verdade, selado em cristal por Battler.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被戰人以水晶封印的，唯一真實之書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被战人以水晶封印的，唯一真实之书。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il libro dell'Unica Verità, sigillato nel cristallo da Battler.

Steam (ST): Until this seal is undone, I can't even stick the key in the keyhole.
Umineko Project (UP): Until I undo this seal, I can't even stick the key in the keyhole.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Until I undo this seal, I can't even stick the key in the keyhole.
PC Japanese (JP): その封印を解かねば、鍵を挿すことさえ出来ない。
Russian (RU): Не сняв печать, я даже не смогу вставить ключ в замочную скважину.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até que eu desfaça este selo, eu sequer posso colocar a chave na fechadura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不解開那封印的話，都無法將鑰匙插入。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不解开那封印的话，都无法将钥匙插入。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Finché non rimuovo questo sigillo, non posso neanche inserire la chiave nella serratura.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...You can remove this, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......You can remove it, right? This seal."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......You can remove this, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あんたには解けるのよね？　その封印。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……あんたには解けるのよね？　その封印」
Russian (RU): "......Ты же можешь снять эту печать?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Você pode remover, certo? Este selo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……你能解得開吧？這封印。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……你能解得开吧？这封印。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Puoi rimuoverlo, giusto? Questo sigillo."

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "Of course."
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「もちろん。」
Russian (RU): "Конечно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É claro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「當然。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「当然。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ovviamente."

Steam (ST): They were in a vast, dimly-lit space.
Umineko Project (UP): They were in a vast, dimly‐lit space.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were in a vast, dimly-lit space.
PC Japanese (JP): そこは、薄暗く、そして広大な広大な空間だった。
Russian (RU): Они были в обширном, тускло освещённом пространстве.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas estavam em um vasto espaço obscurecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那裡是，昏暗而又非常非常寬廣的空間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那里是，昏暗而又非常非常宽广的空间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erano in un vasto spazio poco illuminato.

Steam (ST): To sum it up in a phrase, ...it was like a trench in the ocean floor.
Umineko Project (UP): To sum it up in a phrase, ......it was like a trench in the ocean floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To sum it up in a phrase, ......it was like a trench in the ocean floor.
PC Japanese (JP): その空間は、たった一言で言い表すなら、……海の底の、海溝。
Russian (RU): Если описывать одной фразой...... оно напоминало траншею на дне океана.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para resumir em uma frase, ......era como um abissal no fundo do oceano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個空間要用一個詞來表述的話，……就是海底的海溝。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个空间要用一个词来表述的话，……就是海底的海沟。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per riassumerlo in una frase... era come una fossa nel fondale oceanico.

Steam (ST): No, that's not quite right. It was...a library.
Umineko Project (UP): No, that's not quite right. It was......a library.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, that's not quite right. It was......a library.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは正しくない。正しくは、……図書館。
Russian (RU): Нет, не совсем так. Это была...... библиотека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, não está totalmente certo. Era......uma biblioteca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是這並不正確。正確的是，……圖書館。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是这并不正确。正确的是，……图书馆。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): No, non è del tutto giusto. Era... una biblioteca.

Steam (ST): However, the number of books and the height of the shelves vastly surpassed all of those that existed in the world of humans.
Umineko Project (UP): However, the number of books and the height of the shelves vastly surpassed all of those that existed in the world of humans.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the number of books and the height of the shelves vastly surpassed all of those that existed in the world of humans.
PC Japanese (JP): ただし、蔵書の数と本棚の高さが、人の世に存在するそれら全てを足したよりも、遥かに遥かに、……莫大で広大で絶大だった。
Russian (RU): Но число книг и высота полок значительно превосходили все существующие книги и полки в мире людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, o número de livros e a altura das prateleiras superavam imensamente todas as que existiam no mundo dos humanos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，無論藏書的數量還是書架的高度，都是比人類世界裡有的一切加起來，……還要龐大、廣大、絕大。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，无论藏书的数量还是书架的高度，都是比人类世界里有的一切加起来，……还要庞大、广大、绝大。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, il numero dei libri e l'altezza degli scaffali sorpassavano ampiamente tutti quelli che esistevano nel mondo degli umani.

Steam (ST): If height is the measure of greatness, ...then the gods must surely be giants taller than mountains.
Umineko Project (UP): If height is the measure of greatness, ...then the gods must surely have been giants taller than mountains.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If height is the measure of greatness, ...then the gods must surely be giants taller than mountains.
PC Japanese (JP): もし、背の高さが偉大さで決まるなら。……神々は山の頂を越えるような巨人だったろう。
Russian (RU): Если высота — мера величия, ...тогда боги однозначно должны быть гигантами выше гор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se a altura é a medida da grandeza, ...então os deuses certamente devem ter sido gigantes ainda mais altos que montanhas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果，身高能夠決定偉大程度的話。……估計是能高過神明所居住的山頂般的巨人吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果，身高能够决定伟大程度的话。……估计是能高过神明所居住的山顶般的巨人吧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se l'altezza è la misura dell'importanza... allora gli dei devono sicuramente essere giganti più alti delle montagne.

Steam (ST): This place appeared to be a library big enough and grand enough for such gods.
Umineko Project (UP): This place appeared to be a library big enough and grand enough for such gods.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This place appeared to be a library big enough and grand enough for such gods.
PC Japanese (JP): ここは、そんな神々に相応しい大きさと偉大さを持つ、そんな図書館に見えた。
Russian (RU): Это место выглядело достаточно большой и великой библиотекой для таких богов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este lugar parecia ser uma biblioteca grande o suficiente e imponente o suficiente para esses deuses.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這裡就是，有著和神明相符的大小和偉大的，這樣的圖書館。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这里就是，有着和神明相符的大小和伟大的，这样的图书馆。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo posto sembrava essere una biblioteca abbastanza grande e magnifica per tali dei.

Steam (ST): Each individual book was no larger than those from the human world.
Umineko Project (UP): Each individual book was no larger than those from the human world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Each individual book was no larger than those from the human world.
PC Japanese (JP): 本の一冊一冊の大きさは、人の世のそれと変わらない。
Russian (RU): Каждая книга была не больше книги мира людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada livro não era maior que aqueles do mundo humano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 每一冊書的大小，和人世間的書一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 每一册书的大小，和人世间的书一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ogni singolo libro non era più grande di quelli del mondo umano.

Steam (ST): However, the shelves holding them stood like the walls of a valley...or rather a deep-sea ocean trench.
Umineko Project (UP): However, the shelves holding them stood like the walls of a valley......or a deep‐sea ocean trench.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the shelves holding them stood like the walls of a valley......or like a deep-sea ocean trench.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それを収めた本棚は、まるで渓谷のように、いや、深海の海溝のようにそびえ立っているのだ。
Russian (RU): Но полки с ними стояли как стены долины...... или как глубоководная океанская траншея.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, as prateleiras que os sustentavam pareciam com as paredes de um vale...... ou um abismo nas profundezas do oceano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，收納書的書架，就像是山谷一般，不，是像深海的海溝一樣聳立著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，收纳书的书架，就像是山谷一般，不，是像深海的海沟一样耸立着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, gli scaffali su cui si trovavano erano come i muri di una valle... o come una profonda fossa oceanica.

Steam (ST): So, ...Ange and the others looked like little more than a few small butterflies who had wandered into this vast library.
Umineko Project (UP): So, ......Ange and the others looked like little more than a few small butterflies who had wandered into this vast library.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, ......Ange and the others looked like little more than a few small butterflies who had wandered into this vast library.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、……そんな広大な空間に浮かぶ縁寿たちの姿は、図書館に迷い込んだ、小さな蝶程度にも見えない。
Russian (RU): Поэтому...... Энджи и другие выглядели не иначе как маленькими бабочками, залетевшими в эту обширную библиотеку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ......Ange e Bern pareciam pouco mais do que algumas pequenas borboletas que haviam entrado nesta vasta biblioteca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，……浮在這寬廣的空間中的緣壽，就像是在圖書館中迷路的，小小蝴蝶一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，……浮在这宽广的空间中的缘寿，就像是在图书馆中迷路的，小小蝴蝶一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi... Ange e le altre sembravano piccole come delle farfalle che si aggiravano in questa vasta biblioteca.

Steam (ST): ...Like miniscule deep-sea fish swimming about all alone in an ocean pit.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Like minuscule deep‐sea fish swimming about all alone in an ocean pit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Like miniscule deep-sea fish swimming about all alone in an ocean pit.
PC Japanese (JP): ……深き深き海底の、海溝の底を寂しく泳ぐ、小さな深海魚のようにも見えた。
Russian (RU): ......Как глубоководные рыбёшки, плавающие в океанской яме.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Como peixinhos minúsculos do abismo marinho, nadando sozinhos nas regiões abissais do oceano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……也像是在深深海底的海溝底部寂寞地游著的，小小的深海魚一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……也像是在深深海底的海沟底部寂寞地游着的，小小的深海鱼一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Come minuscoli pesci abissali che nuotavano tutti soli in una fossa oceanica.

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "This is more like ice than a seal. ...If you just steal it away from Battler and put it under the rays of the sun, it will fade away by itself as time passes."
Umineko Project (UP): "This is more like ice than a seal. ......If you just steal it away from Battler and put it under the rays of the sun, it will fade away by itself as time passes."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「これは封印じゃなくて、氷みたいなものよ。……戦人の手から奪えば、日向に置いとくだけで、時間を掛ければ勝手に解ける程度の脆いもの。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「これは封印じゃなくて、氷みたいなものよ。……戦人の手から奪えば、日向に置いとくだけで、時間を掛ければ勝手に解ける程度の脆いもの」
Russian (RU): "Это больше лёд, чем печать. ......Если положить его под лучи солнца, забрав у Баттлера, он со временем растает сам по себе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isto é mais como gelo do que um selo. ......Se você simplesmente roubá‐lo do Battler e deixá‐lo sob os raios do sol, ele desaparecerá sozinho à medida que o tempo passa."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這不是封印，而是冰一般的東西。……是從戰人手中奪走後，只需放在太陽底下，經過一段時間就能隨便解開一般的脆弱之物。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这不是封印，而是冰一般的东西。……是从战人手中夺走后，只需放在太阳底下，经过一段时间就能随便解开一般的脆弱之物。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Questo è più come del ghiaccio che un sigillo. ... Se lo rubi a Battler e lo esponi ai raggi del sole, svanirà da solo col passare del tempo."

Umineko Project (UP): "Isn't there some way to just smash it open?"

Umineko Project (UP): "......Do you like to thaw your frozen fish by smashing it with a hammer?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Você gostaria de descongelar seu peixe esmagando‐o com um martelo?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……你会把冷冻秋刀鱼，用锤子敲着解冻吗？」

Steam (ST): "Sorry, I was always terrible in cooking class."
Umineko Project (UP): "Sorry, I was always terrible in cooking class."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Desculpe, eu sempre fui péssima nas aulas de culinária."

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "...Kitties, thaw this seal."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Kitties, thaw this seal."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): When {f:5:Bernkastel} whispered, from the dark ocean pit deep below them, ...several emerald green glints appeared and gathered like a school of fish.
Umineko Project (UP): When {f:5:Bernkastel} whispered, from the dark ocean pit deep below them, ......several emerald‐green glints appeared and gathered like a school of fish.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Bernkastel whispered, from the dark ocean pit deep below them, ......several emerald green glints appeared and gathered like a school of fish.
PC Japanese (JP): ベルンカステルがそう呟くと、遥か眼下の深海の暗がりや本棚の陰から、エメラルドグリーンの輝きがいくつも現れ、それが集まって、魚群を作るのが見える。
Russian (RU): В ответ на шёпот {f:5:Бернкастель} из тёмной океанской ямы глубоко под ними......появились и собрались, словно стая рыб, несколько изумрудных бликов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando {f:5:Bernkastel} sussurrou, da fossa escura do oceano bem abaixo delas, ......várias faíscas verde‐esmeralda apareceram e se juntaram como um cardume de peixes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝倫卡斯泰露這樣說著，從遙遠的下方的深海的暗處和書架的後面，出現了無數祖母綠的光輝，這些集合起來，就像是形成魚群一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝伦卡斯泰露这样说着，从遥远的下方的深海的暗处和书架的后面，出现了无数祖母绿的光辉，这些集合起来，就像是形成鱼群一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando Bernkastel sussurrò, dall'oscura fossa oceanica sotto di loro... diversi luccichii di colore smeraldo apparvero e si riunirono come un banco di pesci.

Steam (ST): {f:5:Bernkastel} threw the Book of the Single Truth down to them, and only after several seconds passed, the school of fish seemed to gather around it and carry it away.
Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Bernkastel} threw the Book of the Single Truth down to them, and only after several seconds passed, the school of fish seemed to gather around it and carry it away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Bernkastel threw the Book of the Single Truth down to them, and only after several seconds passed, the school of fish seemed to gather around it and carry it away.
PC Japanese (JP): その眼下の魚群に一なる真実の書を放ると、数秒遅れてから、魚群がそれに群がって、どこかへ運んでいく様子が見えた。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Бернкастель} бросила им книгу единственной правды, и только спустя секунды стая рыб собралась вокруг книги и унесла её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Bernkastel} atirou o Livro da Única Verdade para eles, e somente após vários segundos se passarem, o cardume de peixes pareceu juntar‐se em volta dele e carregá‐lo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把唯一真實之書拋給眼下這魚群，數秒之後，魚群圍著它聚集，似乎是要給運到別處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把唯一真实之书抛给眼下这鱼群，数秒之后，鱼群围着它聚集，似乎是要给运到别处。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Bernkastel lanciò a loro il Libro dell'Unica Verità, e solo dopo che passarono diversi secondi, il banco di pesci sembrò radunarsi intorno a esso e portarlo via.

Steam (ST): Those few seconds made it clear just how deep this bookshelf trench went.
Umineko Project (UP): Those few seconds made it clear just how deep this bookshelf trench went.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those few seconds made it clear just how deep this bookshelf trench went.
PC Japanese (JP): その数秒は、どれほどこの本棚の海溝が深いかを示す。
Russian (RU): Те несколько секунд дали понять, насколько глубока траншея книжных полок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esses poucos segundos deixaram claro o quão profundo era o abismo da estante de livros.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這幾秒時間，表示了書架的海溝到底有多深。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这几秒时间，表示了书架的海沟到底有多深。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quei pochi secondi avevano chiarito a quale profondità arrivasse questo scaffale della fossa.

Steam (ST): Ange was once again dumbfounded by this unimaginably vast and godly library...
Umineko Project (UP): Ange was once again dumbfounded by this unimaginably vast and godly library...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange was once again dumbfounded by this unimaginably vast and godly library...
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿は改めてこの、神々の図書館の想像を絶する広大さに、呆然とする…。
Russian (RU): Энджи снова поразилась этой невообразимо обширной и благочестивой библиотеке...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange mais uma vez ficou estupefata diante da monumental e divina biblioteca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽再次驚嘆於，這神明的圖書館大得超乎想像…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿再次惊叹于，这神明的图书馆大得超乎想象…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ange era nuovamente stupita da questa biblioteca incredibilmente vasta e divina...

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "We can just let them handle the rest."
Umineko Project (UP): "We can just let them handle the rest."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): Ange finally realized that she had nothing to gain by complaining more and annoying this witch further...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange finally realized that she had nothing to gain by complaining more and annoying this witch further...

Steam (ST): "...Once you've dissolved the barrier, call me right away."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Once you've broken the seal, call me right away."

Umineko Project (UP): "Of course. I also want to read it as soon as possible. I'll call for you at once."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「もちろんよ。私だって早く読みたいもの。すぐに呼ぶわ」

Umineko Project (UP): Bern spun away from them, then vanished into the dark bookshelf trench.

Umineko Project (UP): Ange saw a school of emerald‐green fish appear and follow behind {f:5:Bernkastel}. ......Could those be her familiars?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange saw a school of emerald green fish appear and follow behind Bernkastel. ......Could those be her familiars?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 可以看到祖母绿的鱼群出现，追随着她。……那些是使魔们吧？

Umineko Project (UP): ".........Just what is this place? It's way too big to be called a library."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Just what is this place? It's way too big to be called a library."

Umineko Project (UP): "It's not like you'll be able to remember its name, so why not just call it the library?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「反正也记不住，就叫它图书馆怎样？」

Umineko Project (UP): "I'll decide what I can or can't remember. Tell me."

Steam (ST): "It's "the Great Witch of Theatergoing, Drama, and Spectating's Noble City of Carefully Selected Books"."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's "the Great Witch of Theatergoing, Drama, and Spectating's Noble City of Carefully Selected Books"."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's 'the Great Witch of Theatergoing, Drama, and Spectating's Noble City of Carefully Selected Books'."

Steam (ST): If I think of those emerald green lights flowing beneath us as headlights on a highway, then this really does seem like a city of books.
Umineko Project (UP): If I think of those emerald‐green lights flowing beneath us as headlights on a highway, then this really does seem like a city of books.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I think of those emerald green lights flowing beneath us as headlights on a highway, then this really does seem like a city of books.

Steam (ST): "That's right. Each volume is packed with an ensemble play. ...They look like books from here, but if you open one up, you'll find a whole world inside."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ。これら一冊一冊が、重厚な群集劇をまとめたもの。……ここでは本に見えますが、本を開けば、そこには本当に世界があるのです」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Каждый том заполнен коллекцией драм. ......Отсюда они выглядят как книги, но в каждой из них целый мир."

Umineko Project (UP): However, that feeling withered away with Eva's death.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "You're going to expose the truth your beloved Onii-chan is hiding, even though it's meaningless? You're the one who's not making sense."
Umineko Project (UP): "You're going to expose the truth your beloved Onii‐chan is hiding, even though it's meaningless? You're the one that's not making sense."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You're going to expose the truth your beloved Onii-chan is hiding, even though it's meaningless? You're the one that's not making sense."

Steam (ST): Erika laughed mockingly. Ange laughed too, as though she agreed.
Umineko Project (UP): Erika laughed mockingly.{n}Ange laughed too, as though she agreed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika laughed mockingly. Ange laughed too, as though she agreed.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "And so, my own truth became my goal. ...Maybe you could even call it my reason for living."
Umineko Project (UP): "And so, truth to me became my goal. ......Maybe you could even call it my reason for living."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "And so, my own truth became my goal. ......Maybe you could even call it my reason for living."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だからね。私にとっての真実は、目的に変わったの。……生きるための、理由とでも言えばいいのかしら」
Russian (RU): "И поэтому моей целью стала моя собственная правда. ......Можно даже назвать её моим смыслом жизни."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi, la mia stessa verità è diventata il mio obiettivo. ... Forse potresti anche dire che è la mia ragione di vivere."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "So, once you do reach the truth, there won't be any point or purpose to you living anymore, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So, once you do reach the truth, there won't be any point or purpose to you living anymore, right?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那，抵达真实之后，你活着的意义和目的，就都没有了吧？」

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "That's right. So, I'll die. ...Hasn't it been long enough? I've already lived 12 years too long. Don't I at least deserve to have a witch appear and grant my wish in my final moments?"
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. So, I'll die. ......Hasn't it been long enough? I've already lived twelve years too long. Don't I at least deserve to have a witch appear and grant my wish in my final moments?"

PC Japanese (JP): 「そうよ。だから、死ぬの。……もういいじゃない。１２年も余計に生きたのよ。そんな私に最期の瞬間くらい、願いを叶えてくれる魔女が現れてもいいとは思わない？」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Поэтому я умру. ......Разве этого мало? Я уже прожила слишком долгие 12 лет. Разве я не заслужила, чтобы, по крайней мере, в мои последние мгновения передо мной появилась ведьма и исполнила моё желание?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. Então, eu morrerei. ......Já não foi tempo o suficiente? Eu já vivi doze anos demais. Eu não mereço que uma bruxa apareça e conceda meu desejo nos momentos finais?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊。所以，我会死。……已经够了吧？我已经多活了 12 年了。在我人生的最后瞬间，出现来实现我愿望的魔女，你不觉得也很好么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esatto. Quindi, morirò. ... Non è già passato troppo tempo? Ho già vissuto dodici anni di troppo. Non mi merito almeno che una strega appaia e avveri il mio desiderio nei miei ultimi momenti?"

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Yeah. So, both my reason for living and my very existence...are completely meaningless. ...That's why this goal of finding the Book of the Single Truth has put a little sparkle back into my life, now that it's nearly over. ...At least on that score, I'm grateful to {f:5:Bernkastel}."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah. So, my reason for living, my very existence, and everything else is meaningless. ......That's why this goal of finding the Book of the Single Truth has put a little sparkle back into my life, now that it's nearly over. ......At least on that score, I'm grateful to {f:5:Bernkastel}."

So, my reason for living, my very existence, and everything else is meaningless. ......That's why this goal of finding the Book of the Single Truth has put a little sparkle back into my life, now that it's nearly over. ......At least on that score, I'm grateful to Bernkastel."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうよ。だから、私の存在も生きる目的も、何もかもが無意味。……一なる真実の書に辿り着くという目的は、そんな私に、人生最後のちょっとした煌きを与えてくれたわ。……その一点でだけ、ベルンカステルには感謝してるわ」
Russian (RU): "Да. Поэтому мой смысл жизни, само моё существование и всё остальное бессмысленно. ......Вот почему цель найти книгу единственной правды вернула в мою жизнь искорку теперь, когда она почти закончена. ......По крайней мере, за это я благодарна {f:5:Бернкастель}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Por isso, minha razão de viver, minha própria existência e tudo mais não faz sentido. ......É por isso que esse objetivo de encontrar o Livro da Única Verdade voltou a brilhar na minha vida, agora que ela está quase terminada. ......Pelo menos neste ponto, eu sou grata à {f:5:Bernkastel}."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì. Allora, la mia ragione di vivere, della mia esistenza, e tutto il resto non ha significato. ... Ecco perché questo obiettivo di trovare il Libro dell'Unica Verità ha riportato un piccolo bagliore nella mia vita, adesso che è quasi finita. ... Almeno su quello, sono grata a Bernkastel."

Umineko Project (UP): Finding the truth of that day...... I decided I'd use that to mark the end of my life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Finding the truth of that day...... I decided I'd use that to mark the end of my life.

Steam (ST): For 12 years, I've believed in a miracle, but there was no miracle...
Umineko Project (UP): For twelve years, I've believed in a miracle, but there was no miracle...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For 12 years, I've believed in a miracle, but there was no miracle...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 12 年间，一直相信着奇迹活过来，奇迹却没有发生…。

Steam (ST): I won't...believe in miracles anymore...
Umineko Project (UP): I won't......believe in miracles anymore.........
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I won't......believe in miracles anymore......

Russian (RU): Я...... больше не верю в чудеса......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não......acreditarei mais em milagres.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我已經，……不再相信奇跡了………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我已经，……不再相信奇迹了………。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Io non... crederò più nei miracoli...

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...The Book of the Single Truth, huh? Of course, I'm also dying to find out what's in it, but from what I hear, it doesn't sound like the truth inside is something spectacular enough to mark the end of your life with."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The Book of the Single Truth. Of course, I'm also dying to find out what's in it, but from what I hear, it doesn't sound like the truth inside is something spectacular enough to mark the end of your life with."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……一なる真実の書。内心は私も興味津々でしたが。そんなあんたの人生のピリオド扱いじゃ、大した真実は記されてなさそうですね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……一なる真実の書。内心は私も興味津々でしたが。そんなあんたの人生のピリオド扱いじゃ、大した真実は記されてなさそうですね」
Russian (RU): "......Книга единственной правды. Разумеется, я тоже сгораю от нетерпения узнать, что в ней, но судя по тому, что я слышала, правда внутри не такая захватывающая, чтобы отмечать ею конец своей жизни."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O Livro da Única Verdade. Naturalmente, eu também estou morrendo de vontade para descobrir o que há dentro dele, mas, a partir do que eu ouvi, não parece que a verdade contida dentro dele é algo espetacular o suficiente para marcar o fim da sua vida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……唯一真實之書。雖然我也對其內容深感興趣。但既然能作為你這樣的人生的休止符，看來也沒記述著多大的真實。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……唯一真实之书。虽然我也对其内容深感兴趣。但既然能作为你这样的人生的休止符，看来也没记述着多大的真实。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Il Libro dell'Unica Verità. Ovviamente, anch'io muoio dalla voglia di scoprire cosa c'è all'interno, ma da quello che sento, non sembra che la verità al suo interno, sia qualcosa di abbastanza spettacolare con cui segnare la fine della tua vita."

Steam (ST): "Yeah. ...At first, I hoped there would be something earth-shattering in it. But now, ...I've calmed down, I guess you could say."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yeah. ......At first, I hoped there would be something earth-shattering written in it. But now......I guess I've cooled on it."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Any truth searched for by a worthless person is bound to be worthless. It'll probably make for a fitting end to your worthless life."
Umineko Project (UP): "Any truth searched for by a worthless person is bound to be worthless. It'll probably make for a fitting end to your worthless life."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「無価値なあんたが求める真実なんて、どうせ無価値です。それが、あんたという無価値な人生のピリオドに相応しいでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「無価値なあんたが求める真実なんて、どうせ無価値です。それが、あんたという無価値な人生のピリオドに相応しいでしょう」
Russian (RU): "Любой правде, искомой никчёмным человеком, суждено быть никчёмной. Возможно, она будет подходящим концом вашей никчёмной жизни."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Qualquer verdade buscada por uma pessoa inútil está destinada a ser inútil. Provavelmente será um final adequado à sua vida inútil."

Steam (ST): "Being able to withstand the truth is what makes someone a Witch of Truth. ...Comrade Ange, it looks like you don't possess that strength after all. If you did, you wouldn't be thinking about dying."

Russian (RU): "Верно. Эти козлоголовые продолжают рождаться из моря интернета. Та первая волна была лишь шушерой. Вторая будет совершенно другой. В ней состоят лучшие из лучших — элитные, выбранные из толпы козлоголовые, способные смести все съёжившиеся фигуры одну за другой. Всего их сотни тысяч. ......Сотни тысяч для опровержения существования нескольких десятков человек, скрывающихся на острове."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. Essas cabras continuam nascendo do oceano da internet.{n}Essa primeira onda foi apenas a ralé. A segunda será completamente diferente. É composta das melhores cabras de elite, selecionadas entre a multidão, capazes de negar todas as peças acuadas, uma a uma. No total, elas somam centenas de milhares. ......Cem mil pessoas para negar a existência de algumas dúzias escondidas em uma ilha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對。那些山羊們從網絡之海中可以誕生出無數。第一陣，不過是一群廢物。第二陣就不同了。是從無數的山羊中，選出能夠否定據守中的所有棋子的每個個體的，特化了的最精銳分子編成的。總兵力是十萬。……為了否定據守在島上的，不過數十人，而準備了十萬的否定。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对。那些山羊们从网络之海中可以诞生出无数。第一阵，不过是一群废物。第二阵就不同了。是从无数的山羊中，选出能够否定据守中的所有棋子的每个个体的，特化了的最精锐分子编成的。总兵力是十万。……为了否定据守在岛上的，不过数十人，而准备了十万的否定。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È così. Quei caproni continuano a nascere dal mare dell'internet. Quella prima ondata era solo la feccia. La seconda ondata sarà completamente diversa. {n}È composta dal meglio del meglio, caproni di alto livello scelti dalla folla che sono capaci di negare tutti i pezzi tremanti uno a uno. In totale, sono una centinaia di migliaia. ... Centomila persone per negare l'esistenza di qualche dozzina che si nascondono su un'isola."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se fosse stata davvero crudele, probabilmente mi avrebbe ordinato di prendere il comando della seconda ondata e giustiziare la mia stessa famiglia.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Comrade Ange, you're a Witch of Truth, aren't you?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Comrade Ange. You are a Witch of Truth, aren't you?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「同志縁寿。あんたは、真実の魔女なんですよね？」
Russian (RU): "Товарищ Энджи. Вы ведь ведьма правды?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Confrade Ange. Você é uma Bruxa da Verdade, não?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「同志緣壽。你，是真實的魔女吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「同志缘寿。你，是真实的魔女吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Compagna Ange. Tu sei una Strega della Verità, giusto?"

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...... ...That's right. ...Probably."
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sì. ... Probabilmente."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Then accept the truth, okay? Finally, after 12 years, the Single Truth lies before you."
Umineko Project (UP): "Then let's accept the truth, okay? Finally, after twelve years, the Single Truth lies before you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then let's accept the truth, okay? Finally, after 12 years, the Single Truth lies before you."
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあ、受け容れましょうよ。１２年を経て、ようやく本当の、一なる真実を。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「じゃあ、受け容れましょうよ。１２年を経て、ようやく本当の、一なる真実を」
Russian (RU): "Тогда давайте примем правду. Спустя 12 лет единственная правда наконец лежит перед вами."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então vamos aceitar a verdade, certo? Finalmente, após doze anos, a Única Verdade está à sua frente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼，就接受吧？經過了 12 年，接受總算到手的，真正的唯一真實。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，就接受吧？经过了 12 年，接受总算到手的，真正的唯一真实。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Allora accettiamo la verità, ok? Finalmente, dopo dodici anni, l'Unica Verità giace davanti a te."

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...... ...I'll just sit around here until {f:5:Bernkastel} breaks the seal."
Umineko Project (UP): "..................... ......I'll just sit around here until {f:5:Bernkastel} finishes breaking the seal."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...............I'll just sit around here until Bernkastel breaks the seal."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………………。……私はここで、ベルンカステルが封印を解き終えるのを、気長に待つとするわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………………。……私はここで、ベルンカステルが封印を解き終えるのを、気長に待つとするわ」
Russian (RU): "...............Я посижу здесь, пока {f:5:Бернкастель} не сломает печать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................... ......Eu apenas ficarei sentada aqui enquanto a {f:5:Bernkastel} termina de quebrar o selo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………………。……我就在這裡，慢慢等著貝倫卡斯泰露解開封印吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………………。……我就在这里，慢慢等着贝伦卡斯泰露解开封印吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Starò solo qui finché Bernkastel non avrà rotto il sigillo."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "You'll probably be summoned as a guest for the party. ...We've got a mirror, so maybe you should wipe the sleep from your eyes."
Umineko Project (UP): "You'll probably be summoned as a guest for the party. ......We've got a mirror, so maybe you should wipe the sleep from your eyes."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「恐らくは、パーティーのゲストとしてあなたは呼び出されるでしょう。……姿見はありますので、目やにでも取ってたらどうです？」
Russian (RU): "Вас могут пригласить на вечеринку. ......У нас есть зеркало, так что не хотите ли протереть заспанные глаза?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você provavelmente será invocada como uma convidada para a festa. ......Nós temos um espelho, então talvez você devesse limpar as remelas de sono dos seus olhos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「恐怕，你會被叫去當宴會的賓客吧？……我這裡有梳妝鏡，你要不要把眼屎抹掉？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「恐怕，你会被叫去当宴会的宾客吧？……我这里有梳妆镜，你要不要把眼屎抹掉？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Probabilmente verrai chiamata come ospite della festa. ... Abbiamo uno specchio, quindi forse dovresti toglierti il sonno dagli occhi."

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "And maybe you should shave before heading out to battle."
Umineko Project (UP): "And maybe you should shave before heading out to battle."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「あんたこそ、出陣前に無駄毛でも抜いてきなさいよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あんたこそ、出陣前に無駄毛でも抜いてきなさいよ」
Russian (RU): "А ты тогда побрейся налысо перед боем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E talvez você deva se depilar antes de sair para a batalha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你才是，出陣之前把多餘的體毛拔乾淨吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你才是，出阵之前把多余的体毛拔干净吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "E forse tu dovresti raderti prima di andare in battaglia."

Steam (ST): It floated there in the empty air. ...The door to the Golden Land.
Umineko Project (UP): It floated in the empty air.{n}...The door to the Golden Land.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It floated there in the empty air....The door to the Golden Land.
PC Japanese (JP): 虚無の空間に、………それは浮かんでいた。それは、黄金郷への扉。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 虚無の空間に、………それは浮かんでいた。{n}それは、黄金郷への扉。
Russian (RU): Она парила...... в пустом воздухе.{n}Дверь в Золотую Землю.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela flutuou no ar vazio.{n}...A porta para a Terra Dourada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 虛無的空間中，………那個浮在其中。{n}那是，通向黃金鄉的門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虚无的空间中，………那个浮在其中。{n}那是，通向黄金乡的门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fluttuava lì nell'aria vuota. ... La porta per la Terra Dorata.

Steam (ST): At its base, there was nothing except some floor tiling about as thick as a rug, so it was fairly hard to imagine that this was Kinzo's study.
Umineko Project (UP): One or two square meters of tiled floor still remained in front of the door, scarcely enough to remind a person that this had once been Kinzo's study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At its base, there was nothing except some floor tiling about as thick as a rug, so it was fairly hard to imagine that this was Kinzo's study.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉の足元に、畳み一枚分程度残っている床タイルの模様だけから、それが金蔵の書斎のものであったことを思い出すのは難しい。
Russian (RU): Под ней была только почти такая же тонкая, как ковёр, напольная плитка, поэтому с трудом верилось, что это был кабинет Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um ou dois metros quadrados de piso de ladrilhos ainda permaneciam em frente à porta, apenas o suficiente para lembrar uma pessoa de que este tinha sido o estúdio de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在門的腳邊，只剩下一張榻榻米大小的地板磚，很難想到這裡曾是金藏的書房吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在门的脚边，只剩下一张榻榻米大小的地板砖，很难想到这里曾是金藏的书房吧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Alla sua base, non c'era nulla a parte delle mattonelle spesse come un tappeto, così era abbastanza difficile immaginare che questo fosse lo studio di Kinzo.

Steam (ST): ...By this point, all of the game board except the Golden Land had been eaten away, leaving only this door floating in a sea of nothingness...
Umineko Project (UP): ......By now, all of the game board except the Golden Land had been eaten away, leaving only this door floating in a sea of nothingness......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......By now, all of the game board except the Golden Land has been eaten away, leaving only this door floating in a sea of nothingness......
PC Japanese (JP): ……もはやゲーム盤は、……黄金郷だけを残して、全て全て、食い尽くされてしまい、こうして虚無の海に、その扉だけを浮かべている……。
Russian (RU): ......Вся игровая доска, за исключением Золотой Земли, уже съедена, и осталась только эта дверь, плавающая в море небытия......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Até agora, todo o tabuleiro do jogo, exceto a Terra Dourada, havia sido comido, deixando apenas esta porta flutuando em um mar de nada......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這遊戲盤，……已經全部都被吃光，只剩下黃金鄉的那扇門，這樣子漂浮在虛無之海裡……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这游戏盘，……已经全部都被吃光，只剩下黄金乡的那扇门，这样子漂浮在虚无之海里……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ormai, tutto il campo da gioco eccetto la Terra Dorata era stato divorato, lasciando solo questa porta fluttuante in un mare di nulla...

Steam (ST): There were two shapes in front of that door.
Umineko Project (UP): There were two figures in front of that door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were two shapes in front of that door.
PC Japanese (JP): その扉の前には、二人の人影が。
Russian (RU): Перед дверью стояли двое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia duas figuras na frente daquela porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在那扇門前，有著兩個人影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在那扇门前，有着两个人影。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Vi erano due sagome davanti a quella porta.

Steam (ST): They were Battler...and Beato.
Umineko Project (UP): It was Battler......and Beato.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was Battler...and Beato.
PC Japanese (JP): ……戦人と、ベアトだった。
Russian (RU): ......Баттлер... и Беато.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma era Battler......e a outra Beato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……是戰人和貝阿朵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……是战人和贝阿朵。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erano Battler... e Beato.

Steam (ST): They may not have been literally covered with wounds, but they definitely seemed to be dead tired.
Umineko Project (UP): They may not have been literally covered with wounds, but they definitely seemed to be dead tired.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They may not have been literally covered with wounds, but they definitely seemed to be dead tired.
PC Japanese (JP): 満身創痍とは言わないまでにも、疲労困憊という様子だった。
Russian (RU): Они не были буквально изранены, но, безусловно, выглядели смертельно уставшими.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles podiam não estar literalmente cobertos de feridas, mas definitivamente pareciam estar cansados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說不上是遍體鱗傷，但也是疲憊不堪的樣子了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说不上是遍体鳞伤，但也是疲惫不堪的样子了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non erano letteralmente coperti di ferite, ma sembravano essere davvero stanchi morti.

Steam (ST): Battler, leaning against the door, seemed to have finally caught his breath.
Umineko Project (UP): Battler, leaning against the door, seemed to have finally caught his breath.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler, leaning against the door, seemed to have finally caught his breath.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人は扉に寄り掛かって、ようやく呼吸が落ち着いてきたようだった。
Russian (RU): Баттлер, прислонившийся к двери, наконец отдышался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler, escorado contra a porta, parecia ter finalmente recuperado o fôlego.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人靠著門，似乎總算是平穩了呼吸。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人靠着门，似乎总算是平稳了呼吸。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Battler, appoggiato contro la porta, sembrava aver finalmente ripreso fiato.

Steam (ST): Beato was also sitting against the door, letting her legs dangle gracelessly.
Umineko Project (UP): Beato was also sitting against the door, letting her legs dangle gracelessly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beato was also sitting against the door, letting her legs dangle gracelessly.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトも同じく扉に寄り掛かりながら、足をだらしなく投げ出している。
Russian (RU): Беато тоже сидела, прислонившись к двери и неграциозно свесив ноги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Beato também estava sentada contra a porta, deixando as pernas balançarem sem qualquer elegância.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵也一樣是靠著門，不像樣子地伸著腳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵也一样是靠着门，不像样子地伸着脚。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche Beato stava seduta contro la porta, lasciando penzolare le sue gambe sgarbatamente.

Steam (ST): Could the battle against that force really be called a battle?
Umineko Project (UP): Could the battle against that force really be called a battle?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Could the battle against that force really be called a battle?
PC Japanese (JP): あれだけの軍勢との戦いを、果たして戦いと呼んで良かったのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Можно ли бой против такого войска назвать боем?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Poderia a batalha contra tal força realmente ser chamada de batalha?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 和那樣多的軍勢的戰鬥，最終還能稱之為戰鬥嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 和那样多的军势的战斗，最终还能称之为战斗吗？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poteva la battaglia contro quelle forze essere davvero definita tale?

Steam (ST): It was more like a mere pushing contest on the increasingly small bit of ground that remained.
Umineko Project (UP): It was more like a mere pushing fight on the increasingly small bit of ground that remained.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): それはもはや、食い破られて狭くなる土俵の上での、おしくら饅頭のようなものだった。
Russian (RU): Больше напоминало простое выталкивание на крошечном клочке оставшейся земли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era mais como uma luta de empurrar o pequeno pedaço de chão que restava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那已經像是，在被吃得相當狹窄的比賽場地上，進行的互推較力遊戲一樣了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那已经像是，在被吃得相当狭窄的比赛场地上，进行的互推较力游戏一样了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Somigliava più a dei meri spintoni sul pezzo di terra sempre più piccolo che rimaneva.

Steam (ST): ...They had wanted to protect at least Kinzo's study no matter what.
Umineko Project (UP): ......They had wanted to protect at least Kinzo's study no matter what.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……せめて、金蔵の書斎くらいは死守したかった。
Russian (RU): ......Они хотели во что бы то ни стало защитить хотя бы кабинет Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eles queriam ao menos proteger o estúdio de Kinzo, a todo custo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……至少，也要死守住金藏的書房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……至少，也要死守住金藏的书房。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Avevano voluto proteggere a qualsiasi costo almeno lo studio di Kinzo.

Steam (ST): And, the only fruit of their desperate struggle was the thin bit of flooring that they were sitting on now.
Umineko Project (UP): And, the only fruit of their desperate struggle was the tiny bit of flooring that they were sitting on now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And, the only fruit of their desperate struggle was the thin bit of flooring that they were sitting on now.
PC Japanese (JP): そう願い、奮闘した二人が守りきった面積が、今、彼らの足元になる畳一枚分だけの床なのだ。
Russian (RU): И единственным плодом их отчаянных усилий была тонкая напольная плитка, на которой они сейчас сидели.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, o único fruto da luta desesperada deles era o pedacinho de piso em que estavam sentados agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這樣許願著，奮鬥過的兩人守下來的面積，現在就只有，在他們腳下那一張榻榻米大小的地板了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这样许愿着，奋斗过的两人守下来的面积，现在就只有，在他们脚下那一张榻榻米大小的地板了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E l'unico frutto della loro lotta disperata era il sottile pezzo di pavimento su cui stavano sedendo ora.

Steam (ST): Those goats fell into the abyss whenever they had nowhere to stand.
Umineko Project (UP): Those goats fell into the abyss whenever they had nowhere to stand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those goats fell into the abyss whenever they had nowhere to stand.
PC Japanese (JP): 山羊たちは、足場がなければ奈落に落ちる。
Russian (RU): Козлорогие падали в пропасть всякий раз, когда им было негде стоять.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas cabras caíam no abismo quando não tinham onde ficar em pé.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊們沒有落腳點的話，就會落入深淵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊们没有落脚点的话，就会落入深渊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quei caproni cadevano nell'abisso se non avevano posti su cui stare.

Steam (ST): So now, with so much of the floor gone, there was no way for them to attack anymore.
Umineko Project (UP): So now, with so much of the floor gone, there was no way for them to attack anymore.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So now, with so much of the floor gone, there was no way for them to attack anymore.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、これだけ綺麗さっぱり床がなくなれば、もうヤツらも手が出せまい。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, раз пола практически не осталось, они больше не смогут атаковать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então agora, com tanto espaço que tinha se ido, não havia mais como elas atacarem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，地板一點不留的話，它們也就無法出手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，地板一点不留的话，它们也就无法出手。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi adesso, con così tanto pavimento scomparso, per loro non c'era più modo di attaccare.

Steam (ST): If Battler thought this, his naive hopes were quickly crushed.
Umineko Project (UP): If Battler thought this, his naive hopes were quickly crushed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If Battler thought this, his naive hopes were quickly crushed.
PC Japanese (JP): そうは思ったが、それはすぐに甘い考えだと思い知ることになった。
Russian (RU): Если Баттлер так думал, его наивные надежды быстро разбились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se Battler pensasse assim, suas ingênuas esperanças rapidamente seriam esmagadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然這樣想過，但很快就體會到了那是多麼天真的想法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然这样想过，但很快就体会到了那是多么天真的想法。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se Battler l'avesse pensato, le sue ingenue speranze sarebbero distrutte.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Looks like we're surrounded."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Looks like we're surrounded."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Looks like we're surrounded."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………ぞろりと、取り囲んでやがるな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………ぞろりと、取り囲んでやがるな」
Russian (RU): "......Похоже, мы окружены."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Parece que estamos cercados."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………居然都給我，一口氣全圍過來啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………居然都给我，一口气全围过来啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sembra che siamo circondati."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "They probably plan to gather their forces and crush us in a single stroke..."
Umineko Project (UP): "So, their plan was to gather their forces and crush us in a single stroke..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「増援を集め、今度こそ一度に押し潰そうという魂胆であろう…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「増援を集め、今度こそ一度に押し潰そうという魂胆であろう…」
Russian (RU): "Так они планировали собрать свои войска и разбить нас одним махом..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, o plano deles era reunir forças e nos esmagar de uma só vez..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是預謀著集齊增援，一次把我們擊潰吧…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是预谋着集齐增援，一次把我们击溃吧…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi, il loro piano era di riunire le loro forze e distruggerci in un colpo solo..."

Steam (ST): Stretching across the ocean horizon that surrounded the door at their backs... ...was an encirclement of countless large sailing ships.
Umineko Project (UP): Stretching across the horizon surrounding the door at their backs.........was an encirclement of countless large sailing ships.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Stretching across the horizon surrounding the door at their backs......was an encirclement of countless large sailing ships.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らが背にする扉を、ぐるりと水平線が取り囲むかのように、………大きな帆船が、何隻も包囲している。
Russian (RU): Вдоль горизонта, окружающего дверь за их спинами, ......простирались бесчисленные парусные суда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esticando‐se no horizonte ao redor da parte de trás da porta.........havia um cerco de incontáveis navios imensos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像是要把他們背後的門，在地平線上完全圍住一樣，………數艘巨大的帆船，包圍在周圍。

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "True, true, I have heard the rumors myself. This is that legendary secret diary, which Ushiromiya Eva hid away just before her death...! It is said that she recorded the details of Rokkenjima's truth in there. Just like that fable of the king with the donkey's ears. Humans are tragic creatures, incapable of keeping truly silent regarding secrets only they could know."
Umineko Project (UP): "It really is. I had heard rumors of it myself. A secret diary said to have been hidden away by Ushiromiya Eva just before her death...! Rumor has it that she wrote the details of Rokkenjima's truth in there. It reminds me of that fable of the king with the donkey's ears. Humans truly are tragic creatures, incapable of keeping quiet about a secret even if no one else could possibly learn of it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "True, true, I have heard the rumors myself. That rumored secret diary, which Ushiromiya Eva hid away just before her death...! It is said that she wrote the details of Rokkenjima's truth in there. Just like that fable of the king with the donkey's ears. Humans truly are tragic creatures, incapable of keeping quiet about a secret even if no one else could possibly learn of it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇえぇ、私も噂には聞いておりました。右代宮絵羽が死の直前に隠したと囁かれる、秘密の日記…！　彼女は六軒島の真実をそれに密かに記していたと噂されます。まるで、王様の耳はロバの耳ですな。人は、自分しか知り得ない秘密を、穴を掘ってでも口にせずにはいられない、悲しい生き物なのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇえぇ、私も噂には聞いておりました。右代宮絵羽が死の直前に隠したと囁かれる、秘密の日記…！　彼女は六軒島の真実をそれに密かに記していたと噂されます。まるで、王様の耳はロバの耳ですな。人は、自分しか知り得ない秘密を、穴を掘ってでも口にせずにはいられない、悲しい生き物なのです」
Russian (RU): "Правда, правда, я сам слышал. Это тайный дневник, который Уширомия Ева спрятала прямо перед своей смертью!.. Говорят, что она написала там подробности правды Роккенджимы. Прямо как басня о царе с ослиными ушами. Люди поистине трагичные создания, неспособные молчать о тайне даже если никому её не узнать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, ele existe. Eu mesmo ouvi rumores sobre isso. Um diário secreto que dizem ter sido escondido por Ushiromiya Eva justo antes de sua morte...! O rumor é que ela escreveu os detalhes da verdade de Rokkenjima nele. Isso me lembra aquela fábula do rei com as orelhas do burro. Os humanos são verdadeiramente criaturas trágicas, incapazes de ficar calados sobre um segredo, mesmo que ninguém mais possa descobri‐lo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊，我也聽到了傳聞。據說是右代宮繪羽直到死前都藏著的，秘密的日記…！有傳聞說她秘密地在那上面記述下了六軒島的真實。就像是，國王的耳朵是驢耳的故事一樣啊。人真是，對只有自己能知道的秘密，必須要挖個坑說出來的悲哀的生物。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊，我也听到了传闻。据说是右代宫绘羽直到死前都藏着的，秘密的日记…！有传闻说她秘密地在那上面记述下了六轩岛的真实。就像是，国王的耳朵是驴耳的故事一样啊。人真是，对只有自己能知道的秘密，必须要挖个坑说出来的悲哀的生物。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È vero, è vero, ho sentito la diceria io stesso. Quella di un diario segreto che Eva Ushiromiya avrebbe celato subito prima della sua morte...! Si dice che vi scrisse di nascosto la verità di Rokkenjima. Proprio come quella fiaba del re con le orecchie d'asino. Certo che gli umani sono davvero delle tragiche creature, incapaci come sono di mantenere un segreto anche se nessun altro può in alcun modo venirne a conoscenza."

Steam (ST): And on top of all that, the mysterious Forger Itouikukuro was to appear publicly for the first time. In fact, it seemed that Itouikukuro and Hachijo Tohya, the up-and-coming mystery novelist, were the same person.
Umineko Project (UP): And on top of all that, the mysterious Forger Itouikukuro was to appear publicly for the first time. In fact, it seemed that Itouikukuro and Hachijo Tohya, the up‐and‐coming mystery novelist, were the same person.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, acima de tudo, o misterioso Falsificador Itouikukuro deveria aparecer publicamente pela primeira vez. Pelo que tudo indicava, parecia que Itouikukuro e Hachijo Tohya, o promissor romancista de mistério, eram a mesma pessoa.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E in tutto questo, la misteriosa Falsaria Itouikukuro sarebbe dovuta apparire pubblicamente per la prima volta. Sembrava, infatti, che Itouikukuro e Hachijo Tohya, l'emergente romanziere mystery, fossero la stessa persona.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes da festa da revelação do diário, foi realizada uma conferência de imprensa em um dos cômodos do hotel.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在披露日記的宴會之前，她在賓館的一個房間中接受記者的會見。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在披露日记的宴会之前，她在宾馆的一个房间中接受记者的会见。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima dell'esposizione pubblica del diario, fu tenuta una conferenza stampa in una delle camere dell'hotel.

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "...Indeed. I am Hachijo Tohya."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Indeed. I am Hachijo Tohya."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……如何にも。私が八城十八です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……如何にも。私が八城十八です」
Russian (RU): "......Именно. Я — Хачиджо Тойя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......De fato. Eu sou Hachijo Tohya."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……正是。我就是八城十八。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Proprio così. I sono Hachijo Tohya."

Steam (ST): "Madam Hachijo, we now know that in your previous book signings, you were so determined not to show yourself that you even used a body double, so what has caused you to change your mind and appear before us this time...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "We now know that in your previous book signings, you went to the lengths of using a double to avoid appearing in public. What has caused you to change your mind and appear before us this time...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "We now know that in your previous book signings, you refused to show yourself to the point of using a body double, so what has caused you to change your mind and appear before us this time...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「先生は過去のサイン会においても、影武者を立ててまで姿を現すことを拒まれてきたわけですが、それが今回、こうして姿を現されたのはどういうご心境の変化からでしょう…！」
Russian (RU): "Теперь мы знаем, что на предыдущих раздачах автографов вы отказывались появиться и даже выставили дублёра, так что же заставило вас передумать и появиться перед нами?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Agora sabemos que você chegou a usar um dublê durante os eventos de autógrafos que ocorreram no passado, tudo para evitar aparecer em público. O que a fez mudar de ideia e aparecer diante de nós desta vez...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「先生您過去關於簽售會，就算是用替身也拒絕現身參加，但是這次，像這樣親自現身是因為怎樣的心境變化呢…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「先生您过去关于签售会，就算是用替身也拒绝现身参加，但是这次，像这样亲自现身是因为怎样的心境变化呢…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): " Sappiamo bene che nelle tue precedenti uscite pubbliche per rilasciare autografi ti sei rifiutata di mostrarti al punto di usare una controfigura, perciò cosa ti ha fatto cambiare idea e comparire davanti a noi questa volta...?!"

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "The legend of the Rokkenjima witch has given birth to endless tales. ...Considering the weight of such a legend's demise, and being the mere writer that I am, I felt obligated to show myself as a sign of respect."
Umineko Project (UP): "The legend of the Rokkenjima witch has given birth to endless tales. ......Considering the weight of such a legend's demise, and being the mere writer that I am, I felt obligated to show myself as a sign of respect."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「六軒島の魔女伝説は、無限の物語を生み出してきました。……それが終焉することの意味を考えれば、物書きの端くれとしては、姿を現す形で敬意を表するべきであると感じたからです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「六軒島の魔女伝説は、無限の物語を生み出してきました。……それが終焉することの意味を考えれば、物書きの端くれとしては、姿を現す形で敬意を表するべきであると感じたからです」
Russian (RU): "Легенда о ведьме Роккенджимы породила бесчисленные истории. ......Учитывая, что на этом ей придёт конец, я, простой писатель, посчитала, что обязана показаться в знак уважения."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A lenda da bruxa de Rokkenjima deu origem a contos sem fim. ......Considerando o peso do desaparecimento de uma lenda, e sendo a mero escritora que sou, me senti obrigada a me mostrar como um sinal de respeito."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「六軒島的魔女傳說，誕生了無限的故事。……從要讓其迎來終焉的角度考慮的話，作為寫作者中的無名小輩，我覺得自然應該親自現身以表示敬意。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「六轩岛的魔女传说，诞生了无限的故事。……从要让其迎来终焉的角度考虑的话，作为写作者中的无名小辈，我觉得自然应该亲自现身以表示敬意。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "La leggenda di Rokkenjima ha dato vita ad infinite storie. ... Considerata la gravità della fine di una tale leggenda, ed essendo la mera scrittrice che sono, mi sono sentita obbligata a mostrarmi in segno di rispetto."

Steam (ST): "As a Forger, you announced on the web that you had reached the truth! Does that mean you've already read the contents of that diary?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "As a Forger, you announced on the web that you had reached the truth! Does that mean you have already read the contents of that diary?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「偽書作家としての先生は、ネット上で真実に至ったと公言されておりました！　それはつまり、もう先生は日記の中身をご覧になっているということなのですか！」
Russian (RU): "Как фальсификатор, вы объявили в сети, что узнали правду! Значит, вы уже прочитали содержимое дневника?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como uma Falsificadora, você anunciou na rede que havia alcançado a verdade! Isso significa que você já leu o conteúdo do diário?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「您身為偽書作家，在網上公開宣稱已經抵達了真實！這也就是說，先生您已經看過那日記中的內容了嗎！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「您身为伪书作家，在网上公开宣称已经抵达了真实！这也就是说，先生您已经看过那日记中的内容了吗！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): " In qualità di Falsaria, hai annunciato sul web di aver raggiunto la verità! Significa forse che hai già letto il contenuto di quel diario?!"

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "...And, very soon, those contents will be revealed to everyone."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........And, very soon, those contents will be revealed to everyone."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......And, very soon, those contents will be revealed to everyone."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………そして、それはもうじき、皆さんにも公開されることとなるでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………そして、それはもうじき、皆さんにも公開されることとなるでしょう」
Russian (RU): "......И скоро оно будет раскрыто всем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........E, muito em breve, esse conteúdo será revelado a todos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………這個，再過一會兒，就會向大家公開的吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这个，再过一会儿，就会向大家公开的吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... E, molto presto, quel contenuto sarà rivelato a tutti."

Steam (ST): "Pardon me for asking, but is there any guarantee that the contents of this diary are the truth? One might view it as nothing more than a personal account from a single deceased person."
Umineko Project (UP): "Pardon me for asking, but is there solid proof that the contents of this diary are the truth? It seems that some are claiming it to be no more than the personal account of a single deceased person."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Pardon me for asking, but is there solid proof that the contents of this diary are the truth? It seems that some are claiming it to be no more than a personal account of a single deceased person."
PC Japanese (JP): 「こう言っては何ですが。日記の中に記された内容が真実であるとの保証はあるのでしょうか？　故人の私的記録に過ぎないという穿った見方もあるようですが。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「こう言っては何ですが。日記の中に記された内容が真実であるとの保証はあるのでしょうか？　故人の私的記録に過ぎないという穿った見方もあるようですが」
Russian (RU): "Простите за такой вопрос, но есть ли твёрдое доказательство того, что в дневника написана правда? Некоторые утверждают, что это не более чем личное мнение покойного человека."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Me desculpe a pergunta, mas há alguma prova sólida de que o conteúdo deste diário é a verdade? Parece que alguns estão afirmando que não passa de uma narrativa pessoal de uma única pessoa falecida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這麼說可能有些失禮。不過能保證這日記中記述的內容是真實的嗎？也有人說這不過是故人的私人紀錄而已。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这么说可能有些失礼。不过能保证这日记中记述的内容是真实的吗？也有人说这不过是故人的私人纪录而已。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Scusi se chiedo, ma ci sono solide prove che confermino che il contenuto di questo diario è la verità? Ci sono alcuni che asseriscono non essere niente più delle memorie di un defunto."

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "Not at all. I guarantee it. {p:1:The truth is recorded in this diary.}"
Umineko Project (UP): "That is not the case. I guarantee it. {p:1:The truth is written in this diary}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. I guarantee it. {p:1:The truth is written in this diary.}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ。私が保証します。{p:1:日記には真実が記されています。}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ。私が保証します。{p:1:日記には真実が記されています}」
Russian (RU): "Да. Я гарантирую. {p:1:В этом дневнике написана правда}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Esse não é o caso. Eu garanto. {p:1:A verdade está escrita neste diário}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不。我保證。{p:1:日記中記載著真實。}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不。我保证。{p:1:日记中记载着真实。}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì, lo garantisco. {p:1:La verità è scritta in questo diario.}"

Steam (ST): A stir passed through the crowd, and the room was suddenly filled with camera flashes.
Umineko Project (UP): A stir passed through the crowd, and the room was suddenly filled with camera flashes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oooooohhh. A stir passed through the crowd, and the room was suddenly filled with camera flashes.
PC Japanese (JP): おおおぉ、と会場がどよめき、一斉にカメラのフラッシュを浴びせる。
Russian (RU): О‐о‐о‐о‐о. По толпе прокатился ажиотаж, и в помещении вдруг засверкали вспышки фотоаппаратов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A multidão se agitou e, subitamente, a sala de conferência ficou repleta de flashes da câmera.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哦哦哦哦，的聲音充滿會場，照相機的閃光燈一齊作閃。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哦哦哦哦，的声音充满会场，照相机的闪光灯一齐作闪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oooooohhh. Si poteva cogliere un certo fermento tra la folla, e la stanza fu di colpo invasa dai flash delle macchine fotografiche.

Steam (ST): "This ends Madam Hachijo's interview...! Allow us to express our deep gratitude towards all members of the press for coming on this day! And now, we would like to move on and allow you to take photos of Madam Ushiromiya Eva's diary."
Umineko Project (UP): "This ends Hachijo's interview...! Allow us to express our deep gratitude to all members of the press for coming today! And now we would like to move on and allow you to take photos of Madam Ushiromiya Eva's diary."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "This ends Hachijo's interview...! Allow us to express our deep gratitude towards all members of the press for coming on this day! And now, we would like to move on and allow you to take photos of Madam Ushiromiya Eva's diary."
PC Japanese (JP): 「これにて、八城先生の会見を終了いたします…！　報道各社の皆さん、本日は誠にありがとうございます！　引き続きまして、右代宮絵羽氏の日記の撮影時間に移りたいと思います。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「これにて、八城先生の会見を終了いたします…！　報道各社の皆さん、本日は誠にありがとうございます！　引き続きまして、右代宮絵羽氏の日記の撮影時間に移りたいと思います」
Russian (RU): "На этом интервью с Хачиджо закончено!.. Мы глубоко признательны всем представителям прессы за то, что вы пришли сегодня! А теперь мы бы хотели двинуться дальше и дать вам сфотографировать дневник мадам Уширомии Евы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isto termina a entrevista da Hachijo‐sensei...! Permitam‐nos expressar nossa profunda gratidão a todos os membros da imprensa por terem vindo hoje! E agora gostaríamos de seguir em frente e permitir que vocês tirem fotos do diário de Sra. Ushiromiya Eva."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「由此，八城老師的會見就結束了…！報導各社的諸位，今天真是非常地感謝！之後，將是右代宮繪羽氏的日記的攝影時間。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「由此，八城老师的会见就结束了…！报导各社的诸位，今天真是非常地感谢！之后，将是右代宫绘羽氏的日记的摄影时间。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Questo conclude l'intervista di Hachijo...! Consentiteci di esprimere la nostra profonda gratitudine nei confronti della stampa per essere venuta quest'oggi! {n}E ora, vorremmo andare avanti e permettervi di fare delle foto al diario di Madame Eva Ushiromiya."

Steam (ST): A hotel worker pushed forward a cart covered by a veil.
Umineko Project (UP): A hotel worker pushed forward a cart covered by a veil.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ホテルマンが、ベールで覆われた台車を押してくる。
Russian (RU): Работник отеля толкнул вперёд тележку, накрытую покрывалом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um trabalhador do hotel empurrou um carrinho coberto por um véu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 旅館服務員推來了蓋著布的台車。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 旅馆服务员推来了盖着布的台车。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Un inserviente dell'hotel spinse avanti un carrello coperto da un velo.

Steam (ST): Then, after looking to Hachijo for approval, he removed the veil.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, after looking to Hachijo for approval, he removed the veil.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, after looking to Hachijo for approval, he removed the veil.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、八城が頷くのを確認してから、そのベールを剥ぎ取った。
Russian (RU): Взглянув на Хачиджо и получив разрешение, он снял покрывало.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, depois de ter o assentimento de Hachijo, ele o removeu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，獲得了八城頷首確認，將那蓋布取下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，获得了八城颔首确认，将那盖布取下。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, dopo aver guardato Hachijo per avere l'ok, rimosse il velo.

Steam (ST): There lay...Ushiromiya Eva's diary. The Book of the Single Truth sat there, waiting for its seal to be released.
Umineko Project (UP): There lay.........Ushiromiya Eva's diary.{n}The Book of the Single Truth sat there, waiting for its seal to be broken.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There lay......Ushiromiya Eva's diary. The Book of the Single Truth sat there, waiting for its seal to be released.
PC Japanese (JP): そこには、………右代宮絵羽の日記が。一なる真実の書が、その封印が解かれるのを待っていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そこには、………右代宮絵羽の日記が。{n}一なる真実の書が、その封印が解かれるのを待っていた。
Russian (RU): Там лежал...... дневник Уширомии Евы.{n}Книга единственной правды ожидала снятия своей печати.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ali estava.........o diário de Ushiromiya Eva.{n}O Livro da Única Verdade estava ali, esperando seu selo ser quebrado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 上面放著，………右代宮繪羽的日記。{n}唯一真實之書，等待著解開其封印的日子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 上面放着，………右代宫绘羽的日记。{n}唯一真实之书，等待着解开其封印的日子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lì giaceva... il diario di Eva Ushiromiya. Il Libro dell'Unica Verità si trovava lì, in attesa che il suo sigillo fosse schiuso.

Steam (ST): Hachijo held it to her chest and laughed enigmatically.
Umineko Project (UP): Hachijo held it to her chest and laughed enigmatically.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hachijo held it to her chest and laughed enigmatically.
PC Japanese (JP): 八城はそれを胸に抱えると、ミステリアスに笑う。
Russian (RU): Хачиджо прижала её к груди и загадочно усмехнулась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hachijo segurou‐o contra o peito e riu de maneira enigmática.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 八城將其抱在胸口，神秘地笑著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 八城将其抱在胸口，神秘地笑着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Hachijo lo strinse al petto e rise enigmaticamente.

Steam (ST): Camera flashes came from everywhere, making the Book of the Single Truth glint...
Umineko Project (UP): Camera flashes came from everywhere, making the Book of the Single Truth glint......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Camera flashes came from everywhere, making the Book of the Single Truth glint......
PC Japanese (JP): 一斉にフラッシュが瞬き、一なる真実の書を、眩く浮き上がらせた……。
Russian (RU): Отовсюду сверкали вспышки фотоаппаратов, освещающие книгу единственной правды......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os flashes das câmeras vieram de todos os lugares, fazendo o Livro da Única Verdade brilhar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 閃光燈的齊閃，令唯一真實之書，炫目地浮了起來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 闪光灯的齐闪，令唯一真实之书，炫目地浮了起来……。

Steam (ST): "And that is all for now! If you would all please move to the assembly hall...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "And that is all for now! If you would all please move to the assembly hall...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「以上で会見を終了させていただきます！　それでは皆様、会場の方へ移動をお願いいたします…！」
Russian (RU): "На этом всё! Если вы закончили — переходите в актовый зал!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E isso é tudo por enquanto! Se vocês puderem fazer o favor, encaminhem‐se ao hall de reuniões...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「由此會見就結束了！之後請諸位，向會場的方向移動…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「由此会见就结束了！之后请诸位，向会场的方向移动…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): " Ed è tutto per ora! Se foste così gentili da recarvi tutti in sala riunioni...!"

Steam (ST): Still holding the diary, Hachijo left the press conference room, escorted by men from the hotel.
Umineko Project (UP): Still holding the diary, Hachijo left the press conference room, escorted by men from the hotel.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 八城は日記を抱えたまま、ホテルマンたちに護衛されながら会見場を後にする。
Russian (RU): По‐прежнему держа дневник, Хачиджо в сопровождении работника отеля покинула комнату пресс‐конференции.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda segurando o diário, Hachijo saiu da sala de conferência de imprensa, escoltada por homens do hotel.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 八城抱著日記，由賓館服務員們護衛著離開了會場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 八城抱着日记，由宾馆服务员们护卫着离开了会场。

Steam (ST): Until she went through a door that said "Authorized Personnel Only", the journalists continued to surround her and ask questions, hoping to gather just one more comment.
Umineko Project (UP): Until she went through a door that said "No Entry Unless Authorized", the journalists continued to surround her and ask questions, hoping to gather just one more comment.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Until she went through a door that said 'Authorized People Only', the journalists continued to surround her and ask questions, hoping to gather just one more comment.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女が、関係者以外立入禁止と書かれた扉をくぐるまで、取材陣たちはなおも何かのコメントを取ろうと、彼女を取り囲み質問を投げ掛けるのだった。
Russian (RU): Пока она не прошла за дверь, где было написано «Только для тех, у кого есть разрешение», журналисты продолжали окружать её и задавать вопросы, надеясь собрать ещё хотя бы один комментарий.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até que ela passou por uma porta que dizia "Entrada não permitida, exceto mediante autorização", os jornalistas continuaram a cercá‐la e a fazer perguntas, esperando ouvir apenas mais um comentário.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 直到她走進無關者禁止進入的門，取材者們都還在為了獲得什麼信息，圍著她不斷提問。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 直到她走进无关者禁止进入的门，取材者们都还在为了获得什么信息，围着她不断提问。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fino a quando non ebbe attraversato una porta che diceva ‘Solo Personale Autorizzato’, i giornalisti continuarono a circondarla e riempirla di domande, sperando di raccogliere anche un solo ulteriore commento.

Steam (ST): When the door slammed shut, ...the world twisted.
Umineko Project (UP): When the door slammed shut, .........the world twisted.

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "Things are getting pretty crazy out there. ...Did you enjoy it?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Things are getting pretty crazy out there. ......Did you enjoy it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「相当的热情嘛。……享受得如何？」

Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}
Steam (ST): "...How tiring. ...Still, that went well. And yet, this diary truly is heavy."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It was tiring. ......Though not a bad experience. I must say, though, this diary truly is heavy."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......How tiring. ......Though it didn't feel bad. And yet, this diary truly is heavy."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……疲れる。……だが、悪くない。それにしても、この日記は重いな」
Russian (RU): "......Утомляет. ......Хотя неплохо. Но этот дневник такой тяжёлый."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Foi cansativo. ......Embora não tenha sido uma experiência ruim. Devo dizer, porém, que este diário é realmente pesado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……很累。……但是，感覺不錯。不過話說回來，這本日記可真重。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……很累。……但是，感觉不错。不过话说回来，这本日记可真重。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Stancante. ... Niente di serio, però. Cionondimeno, questo diario è un vero macigno."

Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}
Steam (ST): "I will rest in one of the waiting rooms."
Umineko Project (UP): "I will rest in one of the waiting rooms."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「私は少し控え室で休ませてもらおう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私は少し控え室で休ませてもらおう」
Russian (RU): "Я отдохну в приёмной."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我稍微去准备室休息一下。」

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "You're going to be up again pretty soon. There's no time to rest."
Umineko Project (UP): "You're up again pretty soon. There's no time to rest."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「出番なんてすぐよ。休んでる暇なんてないでしょ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「出番なんてすぐよ。休んでる暇なんてないでしょ」
Russian (RU): "Вскоре ты снова встанешь. На отдых нет времени."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sua vez logo chegará. Não há tempo para ficar descansando."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「马上就又该出场了。没有休息的时间吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Da qui a poco dovrai entrare in scena. Non c'è tempo per riposare."

Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}
Steam (ST): "...In that case, call it a short break so that I can properly enjoy this long-awaited excitement."
Umineko Project (UP): "......In that case, call it a short break so that I can properly enjoy this long‐awaited excitement."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......In that case, call it a short break so that I can properly enjoy this long-awaited excitement."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……では休むと言わず、久しぶりの興奮を噛み締める時間が欲しいと言い直そう」
Russian (RU): "......Тогда будем считать это коротким перерывом, чтобы я могла как следует насладиться долгожданным волнением."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Nesse caso, chame isso de uma pequena pausa para que eu possa aproveitar adequadamente esta excitação longamente aguardada."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……那麼就不說是休息，而說是希望有細細品嘗許久未有的興奮的時間吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……那么就不说是休息，而说是希望有细细品尝许久未有的兴奋的时间吧？」

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "I need to borrow that book. I promised Ange that I'd show her first."
Umineko Project (UP): "I need to borrow that book. I promised Ange that I'd show her first."

PC Japanese (JP): 「この本、借りるわよ。縁寿に、一番に見せる約束をしているわ。」

Russian (RU): "Мне нужно одолжить книгу. Я обещала Энджи, что сначала покажу её ей."

Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}

Umineko Project (UP): "I see. In that case, do as you please."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): Ange had been kept waiting for some time, but she had waited patiently, looking down at the world below her...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange had been kept waiting for some time, but she had waited patiently, looking down at the world below her...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange continuou esperando por algum tempo, mas esperou pacientemente, olhando o mundo abaixo dela....
